channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Czechs appeal for EU help with Radio Free Europe after Trump cuts
item.description: The US president signed an executive order on Friday to stop funding the American global broadcaster, following criticism from Elon Musk.

item.title: Stuck astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore are finally on their way back to Earth
item.description: NASA’s two stuck astronauts are finally on their way home after more than nine months in space. Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams left the International...

item.title: Sen. Chuck Schumer on Israeli strikes, his leadership in the Senate and new book
item.description: Sen. Chuck Schumer joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the new Israeli strikes on Gaza, his leadership in the Senate and his new book, "Antisemitism in Am...

item.title: In the Missouri Ozarks, residents struggle to rebuild after tornadoes
item.description: Twisters that tore through Union County, Missouri killed 6 people. One couple survived against incomprehensible odds in a trailer obliterated by the s...

item.title: Astronauts Butch Wilmore, Suni Williams begin journey home after 9 months in space
item.description: A SpaceX capsule carrying NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams undocked from the International Space Station early Tuesday morning. They're...

item.title: At 83, Martha Stewart celebrates gardening with her 101st book
item.description: Martha Stewart talks gardening, wanting to be "one of the girls" and her 101st book with NPR Morning Edition host Michel Martin.

item.title: Detained Columbia University student disputes government’s ‘bedbugs’ claim in court papers
Family of missing college student asks police that she be declared dead
item.description: Missing University of Pittsburgh student Sudiksha Konanki disappeared in the Dominican Republic resort town of Punta Cana almost two weeks ago.

item.title: "I'm the best leader for the Senate," Schumer says amid pushback over shutdown vote
item.description: Schumer said he is the "best at winning Senate seats" amid questions about his leadership after he voted to advance a GOP measure to fund the governme...

item.title: Trump tests executive power. And, hundreds killed in Israeli airstrikes on Gaza
item.description: A federal judge is requesting the DOJ give a sworn declaration about deportations over the weekend. And, Israel launched surprise airstrikes in Gaza e...

item.title: Israel launches deadly new strikes in Gaza as ceasefire falls apart
item.description: Officials in Hamas-ruled Gaza say the new Israeli assault has killed more than 400 people, as Israel accuses Hamas of refusing to extend the ceasefire...

item.title: Fast-er food: A productivity surge at U.S. restaurants
item.description: A new study finds that after decades of stagnation, fast-food and other restaurants finally saw a surge in productivity.

item.title: Chinese state media hails Trump's cuts to Voice of America
item.description: State newspaper gloated that the network has "now been discarded by its own government like a dirty rag".

item.title: Israel launches waves of strikes on Gaza with more than 400 reportedly killed
item.description: The Israeli military says it is targeting Hamas "terror targets", but eyewitnesses describe a nightmare scenario.

item.title: At least 12 dead in Honduras plane crash
item.description: Officials who took part in the emergency operations said that five people were rescued.

item.title: As Oklahoma reels from deadly wildfires, authorities warn of fresh fire threat
New 'Hunger Games' prequel reminds that sometimes past truths aren't visible
item.description: Sunrise on the Reaping recounts the 50th annual Hunger Games, telling the story of Haymitch Abernathy. It's themes and events conjure images of today'...

item.title: What to expect from Trump's phone call with Putin on Ukraine
item.description: The US president says elements of a Ukraine ceasefire have been agreed, but "much remains" to be worked on.
